badly received scotland found king edinburgh usuall place residence cared found esteeming comming people burthensome hee well knew king charles humour believed whimzies owne hee would put upon necessitie warre scotland useth undertake upon good condition occasion advantage thing king beleeved embassador sent yeare france acquaint truce made one yeare richard wherein hee likewise comprehended councell treated king france resolved send thousand horse five hundred crossebowmen armes another thousand would trouble england understood thing resolved upon come without adoe men armes required brought horse along avoid trouble thinking finde enough scotland according wont furnished necessary much superfluity horse wherewithall furnish forced fit horse excessive price king returned admiral delivered embassage seconded thought better well private publicke condition upon hope england set upon side would likelihood lost king robert could resist importunity people royall published within dayes fighting men appeared banner owne men admirall entred northumberland took diver townes burnt destroyed countrey retired thence hee inforced experienced received advertisement king marching towards great army english army consisted men bowman lance pioners attendant made many horse admirall persisted opinion giving battell brought top hill enemy lay seen order number changed minde resolved come come would doe famous act hee made proposition since must necessity quit field without much rashnesse could made good might doe like enemy doubtlesse would doe wit enemy like finde scotland without defence passing part england likely want defender might ransacking countrey make amends dammage scotland likely receive advice approved came downe hill entred comberland finding resistance ransacked part thereof assayed carlisle unfortunately defended many brave gentleman meane richard entred scotland came edinburgh burnt almost whole towne castle saved fort situation thence troop passing burnt destroyed townes house monastery till came sterling meeting none opposed men warre gone heard comberland king robert retired himselfe place safety cattell driven wood reaped profit harme made insatiate ruinating countrey nay provision victuall shipping cart beene brought england could found food one onely day countrey naturally barren set purpose destroyed much grasse horse bee found king therefore necessitated returne lancaster propounded taking necessary provision along might returne way comberland scot done barring returne must need fall hand proposition pleased councell king himselfe onely one like effected night came earle oxford accesse king whispered unto duke end bring majesty last danger impossible passe hils winter farre advanced without great prejudice richard henry notoriously guilty death obliged doe evill mischiefe force himselfe subject able king made answer one made account duke orleans businesse nothing passed defiance writing count st paul began take revenge little purpose making triviall attempt harmfull himselfe beleeving new duke yorke causer richards death conspiracie oxford heedlesnesse discovered hee caused statue bee made giving hereafter see large mean king france advertised king henry preparation wale set succour glendor judging might redound advantage annoy england anothers pretext make pine away nourishing feaver intestine war effect caused many ship put good equipage brest bretaigne put therein two thousand fighting men command iames burbon count march putting sea two brother lewis iohn found wind contrary roan normandy reason former occurrence many english embassador passed whose advertisement king tooke occasion make himselfe master thereof hee sent thither three thousand fighting men comming thither break day onely scale wall meeting made round opened nearest gate whereby remained without entered passed forward battell aray cry saint george city taken marshall wakened noise got horseback seeing number order thought best yeeld carrying nothing away jewells ready mony like garrison tenne thousand inhabitant followed went gate towards paris whereof keyes hand caused broken open delay dangerous thus english make master place without ransack though without bloud king charles well pleased neighbourhood withdrew himselfe trois champagnia followed queene daughter duke councell leaving count saint paul eustas de lactres chancellor france charge government paris marshall went beauvois another fronteire city normandy intending keepe warily done neede doe lost reputation losse pontois sea open earle ship insomuch scorned siege furnished victuall owne ship else brought unto neighbouring porttownes soone direction saw ship come normandy grew article surrender succoured fifteenth september townes paris bullen king henry hand except crotois guise monsieur de harcourt would never yeeld though king name hee thereunto intreated brother bishop amiens dolphin meane sate still twenty thousand men strong went st serres took charitee upon loyre besieged cone inforcing give hostage surrender case releeved august courage growing warme negotiation egged millitary discipline agreed fight pitcht battell aforesaid day whereupon duke burgony ready goe artois advertifed hereof stayed burgony sending people picardy flanders gave account hereof king henry sentis intreating send unto men good leader answer would send none himselfe would leader whilst mind greater strength body hee promised could performe though sicke hee thought hee come last end truth somwhat bitter season one year notwithstanding according wil heaven ripe full growth able go himselfe willing succour come late commanded duke bedford accompanied earle warwicke lord lead along promising follow himselfe soon possibly could come melune sicknesse growing strong upon hee compelled goe litter carried boy de st vincent mean duke burgony come cone mingled two nation together end might equally share honour avoid difference might arise touching precedencie therein found dolphin willing hazard himselfe upon successe battaile raised siege gone burges forced content honour freed cone duke bedford understanding brother grew worse worse rid post boy de saint vincent burgony able goe along affaire called elsewhere sent hugh de lanoi make excuse visit king finding estate life signes desperate knowing must die finding brother uncle rest sad disconsolate wished praise god tooke unto time honour subject inconstancy fortune sorry nothing leave burthen weighty businesse worth fidelity much comfort lord god justice whilst whereby scandalized hee could indure wicked men forenamed men together queene perceiving nothing done caused parliament called berry suffolke whither hee came together rest peer dreaming evill relying upon owne integrity reason others malice ought done first day parliament passed quietly spent accustomed ceremony second day made prisoner lord high constable england accompanied duke buckingham many others guard set upon servant taken whereof imprisoned hee long hale saith next night found dead bed affirming dyed apoplexie imposthume head although doubt death violent yet man know sort thought hee strangled stiffeled betweene two pillowes many hee red hot spit thrust fundament five prisoner examined condemned carrying execution set liberty marquesse yorke infused much courage thought overcome henry winne honour himselfe alone could doe expect comming others fell notice henry hexam imagining hee offer battell hee would accept hee set upon trench fortune first thing warwicke make proclamation made every henry name men sixteene threescore yeere old upon grievous punishment come present armed serve henry lawfull king edward duke yorke unlawfull gathered together fighting men brought almost unto nottingham hee returned backe either thought edward affaire desperate ayreevery resounding long live henry long live warwicke thought foolishnesse share brother good fortune else hee occasion revenge himselfe edward ingratitude hee tearmed service done unto blood shed many battels danger onely requited bare title marquesse declared himselfe brought along proclaiming henry king others done know whether reason accuse edward ingratitude voluptuous people like given pleasure naturally prodigall owne dissolutenesse backward enough paying owe certain brother could complaine thereof though warwicke injuriously archbishop yorke wore second mitre england earle warwicke wee may believe comines boote owne revenue great crown yeer comming lordship confiscation place meerely conferred upon king grace much day would hatefull dangerous prince pretension grow height meanes recompence onely pretence pretender seeming upbraid doth tacitely demand seeme plead participation prince dignity estate edward knew say alteration hourely increased finding place safe since hee wanted force hee went without great danger linne found two holland ship one english hee imbarkt himselfe waited upon three said ship seven hundred men without manner baggage one penny money great unexpected misfortune immediately presented selfe farre worse hee luckily eschewed hee taken hee none ransome would lost liberty kingdome eight easterlings ship easterlings great enemy english mischiefe could discovering three ship believing english gave chase could come unto till cast anchor alchemar holland ebbe low could winne easterlings cast anchor likewise good way burden ship permitting doe otherwise inforced expect returne tide board monsieur de gretures governour duke burgundy holland luckily time alchemar understanding edward hee sent purpose unto flat bottomd boat forbade easterlings use manner hostility went himselfe bring men city edward time reigne henry seventh afford mee observation upon occasion lighted upon cannot said pretence unto kingdome principall cause enmity betweene house lancaster yorke thinke otherwise erre common sence believe without respect beene incapable hearty friendship reason difference nature derived forefather good house yorke wound edmund duke yorke first father thereof bad house lancaster rested person iohn duke lancaster first father thereof difference notwithstanding whereas good intense constant edmund bad remisse inconstant iohn former never harme naturally inclined good would troubled done evill one ability evill done evill vertuous resolution forbeare goodnesse ceased edmund descended stained fraud malice evill ceased likewise iohn descended proving vertuous henry fourth onely sonne esteeme humane generosity end bore heroicall effect wisdome fortitude two light illuminate action past life illustrate present death saw himselfe abandoned yet stayd served will willingly hee thought would base prejudiciall runne away since thereby lose reputation people whereon welfare depend therefore resolved uttermost hee overcome thing likely succeed well unto hee lose day death would advantageous hee hope safety enemy side scotland onely refuge fading hope notwithstanding new peace lately contracted marriage well might trust thereto fortune prove good otherwise say favour little hope getting thither untaken way generally hated twas impossible passe unknowne feature shape body never seene discerned confused minglemangle vertues wisdome knowing danger unavoidable fortitude resolving die since could eschew danger writer great reason affirme wan honour two houres death done time life concernes soules health god able stone raise child unto abraham pleaseth although difference made easy uneasy since hee framed whole world bare word hee spake made commanded created yet let permitted according humane conjecture say say easy usuall save one naturally good one naturally bad since naturall goodnesse may said materia prima salvation containing disposition wee might saved meere mercy bestowed upon u gratis though rule christianity teacheth u judge one damned yet forbids u doubt man salvation wee richards good tree beareth good fruit may wormy rotten mankinde man created fruition heavenly glory may notwithstanding damned wormeaten wickedness rotten obstinacy sin death afforded invitation yet fought save rest like spectatours moved station came give obedience conquerour gratiously received likewise laying downe armes submitted unto number slaine
